intro: Catodiacrum incurvum, commonly known as the twisted fern, is a unique plant species native to specific regions of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Polypodiaceae and is characterized by its intricate, curling fronds that give it its common name. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments, often found in tropical rainforests. Its leaves are dark green and have a delicate, feathery appearance, which contributes to its ornamental value. Due to habitat loss, Catodiacrum incurvum is considered a rare and endangered species.
